topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5417bbc46368721af6210000#post_5417bbc46368721af6210000

They're about how Hiccup goes from being a complete wimp to one who will eventually become a great hero.

Only the last 4 or so books really emphasize the fact the dragons are going to go way, no matter what.

Also dragons in the books are really, really, REALLY nasty creatures. The book dragons, it is made explicitly clear that 99% of these creatures will gladly slice you into steak. Assuming slicing is that particular species preferred method.

By the way. Camacazi is best absolutely insane little girl barbarian.

topics.body:
"@Bryon":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541894db6368726c97eb0100#post_541894db6368726c97eb0100
His personality and mannerisms. He's the kind of guy who's always prepared for the worst of situations even if those situations are impossible. He dresses like a bat and goes out to fulfill his almost obsession with "justice." And while it may be a very traumatic experience for him, he never moved on from the death of his parents.
